page.title: 03FARMING METHODS
page.content: Traditional methods of spraying weeds and pests with a tractor using boom arm are still used but aerial spraying is used by the more progressive farmers to control aphids and potato blight.After harvest,controlled burning of stubble is carried out, sometimes with disastrous effects on hedges and wildlife.Outside help is not normally employed except for the harvest, when contractors are hired and the combine harvesters work through the night with the aid of large powerful lamps.The grain crops are transported to a farm where there are sheds containing drying equipment and bins marked with each farmers name to store the dry grain ready for transporting to market.Stony soil in the area prevents the growing of potatoes or sugar beet on a large scale.
